DOC.brief_summary: The hypothesis of this study is that temporary biventricular pacing will improve hemodynamic performance in patients with right ventricular dysfunction after open cardiac chamber cardiac surgery.
DOC.criteria: mitral or tricuspid valve surgery patients identified as having preoperative Right Ventricular dysfunction and Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction less than 45 percent Patients with insitu biventricular pacemakers Pregnant or lactating females
DOC.keyword: after open cardiac chamber cardiac surgery
